page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The "Guinea Pig" During the war many airmen were very badly burnt.These men were brought to the Queen Victoria Hospital and operated on by Dr McIndoe.He was able to rebuild the faces and hands of these airmen. The process of skingrafting took many months and in some cases up to a hundred operations spread over several years. While the airmen were at the hospital they formed a club called the Guinea Pig club. It is the only one of its sort in the world.Near the hospital is a public house named "The Guinea Pig".In September every year it welcomes back members of the club.Also not far away is a housing estate with "Lancaster Drive", "Stirling Way","Merlin Way" and "Blenheim Close"- names of the engine and famous aeroplanes of the last war.
